structure.unit: COUNTY ROAD ENGINEER AND MAINTENANCE OF PUBLIC ROADS

law.catch_line: County engineer -- Office -- Supplies -- Records to be turned over to successors.

text.section: The county engineer shall have a properly furnished and equipped office at the county seat of his county.
The fiscal court shall furnish the county road engineer and his employees in the county with all necessary books, stationery and printed forms for the records and uses of their offices.
Each county engineer shall deliver the books, accounts and papers pertaining to his office to his successor at the expiration of his term of office.

law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. secs. 4325, 4356g, 4356h.
